newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia October grain imports slide to 151,100 T.
newsitem.headline: Russia October grain imports slide to 151,100 T.

text.p: Russia's grain imports in October fell by over one third to 151,100 tonnes, according to State Customs Committee data published on Wednesday.
The committee, in figures reported by Interfax news agency, said Russia's October grain exports were flat at 120,600 tonnes.
Imports of wheat and wheat-rye blends slipped in October to 87,700 tonnes from 131,200 tonnes in September, with 35,500 tonnes of the former coming from Kazakhstan.
October wheat flour imports slipped by more than a quarter month-on-month to 26,500 tonnes, with nearly 10,000 tonnes of the total coming from Ukraine.
October barley imports rose to 35,800 tonnes from 26,900 tonnes in September, with nearly all of the total from Kazakhstan.
